Name: Raspberry Collins
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
3 dash Orange Bitters by Angostura optional
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
Prepare garnish of skewered raspberry and lemon slice wheel.
MUDDLE raspberries in base of shaker.
Add next 5 ingredients (all but soda) and SHAKE with ice.
TOP with soda and briefly stir.
Garnish with skewered lemon slice wheel and raspberry (sail).
Review: A popular modern-day adaptation of the classic Collins with a whopping 45ml (1½oz) of lemon juice, yet is far from being overly sour. (I've tried reducing the lemon and rebalancing with less sugar but the result is a lesser cocktail.)
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 1999 by Cairbry Hill, London, England.
